name: ax-un
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wex(s2, wa(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
comment: Axiom of Union. An axiom of Zermelo-Fraenkel set theory. It states that a set ` y ` exists that includes the union of a given set ` x ` i.e. the collection of all members of the members of ` x ` . The variant ~ axun2 states that the union itself exists. A version with the standard abbreviation for union is ~ uniex2 . A version using class notation is ~ uniex . The union of a class ~ df-uni should not be confused with the union of two classes ~ df-un . Their relationship is shown in ~ unipr . (Contributed by NM, 23-Dec-1993.)
